data_maturity_score.evidence: Using Palantir Foundry (enterprise-grade platform) but building internal capabilities, no mention of modern data stack practices (dbt, Airflow, CI/CD), limited governance signals

data_maturity_level.evidence: Sophisticated tooling (Palantir Foundry) but developing internal practices, small team building capabilities, lacks broader data ecosystem maturity

maturity_signals.evidence: No specific modern data stack tools mentioned beyond Palantir Foundry, no CI/CD, testing, or governance practices discussed

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused role on Palantir Foundry development, clear responsibilities around data pipelines and workflows, no mention of backend/ML/DevOps conflation

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Defense/aerospace industry often demanding, startup environment mentioned, but unlimited PTO is positive work-life balance signal

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities around Palantir Foundry development, data pipelines, workflows, and integrations with clear scope

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - location restriction and citizenship requirements are significant barriers, but role definition is clear and compensation is reasonable

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions collaboration with Product Owner and other engineers but no specific reporting structure or manager mentioned

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager level or reporting structure mentioned in job posting

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Mentions growing internal software capabilities but no specific team growth metrics or hiring velocity mentioned

team_composition.evidence: Mentions 'other Software & Data Engineers' suggesting small team, but no specific numbers or composition details provided

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure mentioned in job posting

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions collaboration with Product Owner and stakeholders/users, suggesting cross-functional embedded work style

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Unlimited PTO is positive, but defense/aerospace industry can be demanding, onsite requirement limits flexibility, no specific work-life balance policies mentioned

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No learning budget, conference attendance, mentorship programs, or career progression paths mentioned in job posting

tech_culture_score.evidence: Sophisticated platform (Palantir Foundry) but limited signals about modern engineering practices, no mention of CI/CD, testing, or innovation culture

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source contributions, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No specific development practices mentioned like code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring, or incident response

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on implementing and maintaining Palantir Foundry applications rather than innovation or experimentation

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt management, refactoring, or improving code quality

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, or machine learning tools or workflows in the job posting

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned in job posting

hiring_urgency.evidence: Standard hiring timeline mentioned (minimum 3 days posting, open until filled), no urgent or immediate start requirements

competition_level.evidence: Specialized role requiring Palantir Foundry experience limits candidate pool, but location restriction and citizenship requirements also reduce competition

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Aerospace/defense company mentioned as growing internal software capabilities, suggests scaling phase but not early startup

hiring_velocity.evidence: Growing internal software capabilities suggests steady hiring to build team, but no aggressive expansion signals

team_size_signals.evidence: Mentions 'other Software & Data Engineers' suggesting small team, likely 2-5 people based on language used

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding stage mentioned in job posting

role_creation_type.evidence: Mentions growing internal software capabilities and building team around Palantir Foundry development

strength_details: Transparent compensation range ($90k-$115k) with equity grants
Comprehensive benefits including unlimited PTO, health insurance, 401k
Focused data engineering role working with enterprise-grade Palantir Foundry platform
Opportunity to shape data infrastructure at growing aerospace/defense company
concern_details: Onsite requirement in Berthoud, CO limits remote work flexibility
US citizenship or permanent residency required - no visa sponsorship
No career growth, learning opportunities, or advancement paths mentioned
Highly specialized in Palantir Foundry may limit broader data engineering skills development
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers (1-5 years) with Palantir Foundry experience seeking stable role
Candidates interested in aerospace/defense industry and national security applications
Engineers who value work-life balance and comprehensive benefits over rapid career growth
probe_details: Ask about actual team size and growth plans for the data engineering group
Understand career progression opportunities and skill development paths
Clarify work hours, on-call expectations, and overtime policies in practice
Learn about other technologies used beyond Palantir Foundry and integration patterns
leverage_details: Palantir Foundry experience is specialized and valuable - candidates with this skill have strong leverage
Defense/aerospace domain knowledge combined with data engineering is rare combination
summary.overall_assessment: Solid mid-level data engineering role at growing aerospace company with good compensation and benefits. Main trade-offs are location restriction, citizenship requirements, and limited growth opportunities. Best fit for candidates with Palantir Foundry experience seeking stable role in defense industry.
